abstract.para: This chapter describes the features of the Open Ticket Request System (OTRS). Also you can find information about the hard and software requirements of the ticket system. If you need commercial support for OTRS or want to contact the community, this chapter tells you how to do this.

sect1.title: Basics
sect1.para: The Open Ticket Request System (OTRS) is a web application which can be used with every html compartible web browser. The web interface of OTRS does not use active web content like Flash or Java applets to ensure that the system is also useable with mobil phones or other mobile computers. To use OTRS, theere is no special client operating system necesary, only a HTML browser has to be included in the client operating system.

OTRS is separated in several components. The basic component is the OTRS framework that contains all central functions for the application and the ticket system. Via the web interface of the central OTRS framework it is possible to install additional applications like a web mailer, a content manager, a file manager, a web calendar and a tool to monitor system status informations.

sect1.title: Features
sect1.para: OTRS has many features. The following list is a overview of the features which are included in the central framework.

listitem.para: Webinterface:
Easy and intitionaly handling with a web browser.
Because no active web contents like Flash or Java applets are used, the web interface is useable with nearly every web browser, even with mobil phones or other mobil computers.
A interface to administrate the system via the web is available.
A interface to handle customer request by employees/agents via the web is integrated.
A web interface for customers to write new tickets, check the state and answer old tickets and search through own tickets is available.
The web interface can be customized by differnt themes, own themes can be integrated.
Support for many languages.
The look of output templates can be customized (dtl).
Mails from and into the system can contain several attachments.
Mail interface:
Support for mail attachments (MIME support).
Automatical conversion of HTML into plain text messages (more security for dangerous content and faster searchable).
Mails can be filtered with the X-OTRS headers of the system or via mail addresses, e.g. to sort out spam messages.
PGP support, creation and import of own keys, signing and encrypting outgoing mails, signed and encrypted messages can be displayed.
Support for viewing and encrypting SMIME messages, handling of SMIME certificates.
Auto answers for customers, configurable for every queue.
Email notifications for agents about new tickets, followups or unlocked tickets.
Followups by references or In-Reply-To header entries.
Tickets:
Expanded queue view, fast overview about new requests in a queue.
Tickets can be locked.
Creation of own auto answer templates.
Creation of own auto responders, configurable for every queue.
Ticket history, overview on all events for a ticket (changes of ticket states, replies, notes, e.g.).
Print view for tickets.
Adding own (internal) notes to a ticket (text and attachments).
Ticket zooming.
Access controll lists for tickets can be defined.
Forwarding or bouncing tickets to other mail adresses.
Moving tickets between queues.
Changing/setting the priority of a ticket.
The working time can be accounted for every ticket.
Upcoming tasks for a ticket can be defined (pending features).
Bulk actions on tickets are possible.
Automated and timed actions on tickets are possible with the "GenericAgent".
Full-text search on all tickets is possible.
System:
OTRS runs on many operating systems (Linux, Solaris, AIX, FreeBSD, OpenBSD, Mac OS 10.x, Microsoft Windows).
ASP support (active service providing).
Linking sevveral objects is possible, e.g. tickets and faq entries.
Integration of external backends for the customer data, e.g. via AD, eDirectory oder OpenLDAP.
Seting up a own ticket identifier, e.g. Cal#, Ticket#, Request#, e.g.
Integrating a own ticket counter is possible.
Support of several database systems for the central OTRS backend, e.g. MySQL, PostgreSQL, SAPDB, Oracle).
Framework to create stats.
utf-8 support for the front- and backend.
The authentification for customers can be realized via a database, LDAP, HTTPAuth or Radius.
Support of user accounts, user groups and roles.
Support of different access levels for the several system components or queues.
Integration of standard answer texts.
Support of sub queues.
Different salutations and signatures can be defined for every queue.
Email notifications for admins.
Information about updates via mail or the webinterface.
Eskalation for tickets.
Support for different time zones.
Simple integration of own addons or applications with the OTRS API.
Simple creation of own frontends, e.g. for X11, console.

sect1.title: Hard and software requirements
sect1.para: OTRS can be installed on many operating systems. OTRS runs not only on linux and on other unix derivates (e.g. OpenBSD oder FreeBSD), but also on all Microsoft Windows platforms. OTRS has no big hardware requirements. We recomment to use at least a machine with a 2 GHz Pentium IV or comparable CPU, 512 MB RAM and a 20 GB hard drive.

You need some other software components, if you want to use OTRS. A web and a database server and a working perl envirorment with some additional modules are the basic software requirements for OTRS. The web server and perl hast to be installed on the same machine like OTRS. The database backend can be installed on the local or on a other host.

For the web server we recommend to use apache 1.3.x or apache 2.x. With this web server you can use the mod_perl module, which improves the performance of OTRS rapidly. If you can't use apache, OTRS should run on every other web server that is able to execute perl scripts.

For database backends we recommend to use MySQL (3.1.x or higher) or PostgreSQL. But all database servers, that use SQL for database language, should be able to work with OTRS. If you use MySQL, you have the advantage, that you can configure your database and some system settings during installation through a web frontend.

For perl we recommend to use at least version 5.8. You need some additional modules which can be installed either with the perl shell and CPAN or via the package manager of your operating system (rpm, yast, apt-get).

The section about the
manual installation of needed perl modules
describes more detaled how you can setup the per modules that you need for OTRS.

If you install a binary package of OTRS which was built for your operating system (rpm, Windows-Installer) either the package contains all needed perl modules or the package manager of your system should take care on the dependences to the needed perl modules.

sect1.title: Community
sect1.para:
OTRS has a big user community. Via
mailinglists
users and developers diskus about OTRS and exchange information on the trouble ticket system. There is help for questions about the installation, configuration, usage, localisation and development available. Software bugs can be reported via a
bug tracking system
and reach the developers directly and with no durationand reach the developers directly and very fast. That ensures, that fixes for problems are avilable very quick.

Via the URL
http://www.otrs.org
you can reach the homepage of the OTRS community.

sect1.title: Commercial Support for OTRS
sect1.para:
There is also commercial support available for OTRS. Via the URL
http://www.otrs.com
the pages of the OTRS GmbH can be reached, which represent the commercial part of the OtRS.org project.

The OTRS GmbH provide support, consulting and training for the Open Ticket Request System. Also easy-to-handle complete solutions are provided. With these packets the OTRS GmbH likes to serve medium-sized companies, local authorities, institutions and big corporate groups. You can either buy ready-made high-performance and high-availability systems or order special made-to-measure packets.

On
http://www.otrs.com
are more detailed information about the OTRS GmbH available. You can contact the OTRS GmbH per mail to
sales at otrs.com
